intro: Caladenia testacea var. praecox, commonly known as the Early Showy Spider-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, spider-like appearance. The plant produces a single, showy flower with a distinctive hooded labellum and intricate petal structures. It typically blooms in early spring, often before the main flowering season of other orchid species. This variety is found in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments.
